      This method starts the game by obtaining the number of players and taking the input from the players and initialize them.

      This method gets the country object.

      This method is used to assign armies to the countries so that each country will get at least one army according to the game rule.

      This method checks for continent connectivity.
      boolean Player.isCountryAdjacent(Country attackCountryObject, java.lang.String defenderCountry, GameMap mapDetails)
      This method checks whether the country is adjacent or not.
      boolean Player.isCountryAttackPresent(GamePlayer player, java.lang.String currentCountry, GameMap mapDetails)
      This method checks whether the country which is being attacked is present or not.
      boolean Player.isCountryPresent(java.lang.String currentCountry, GameMap mapDetails)
      This method checks whether this country is present or not.
      boolean Player.isPlayerWinner(GamePlayer player, GameMap mapDetails)
      This method checks whether the player is winner or not.
      void Player.populateCountries(GameMap gameMap)
      This method is used to assign countries to the players Random allocation of countries to players will take place in this method.
      void Player.removePlayer(java.util.ArrayList<GamePlayer> playersList, GameMap mapDetails, java.lang.String playerName)
      This method removes the player from Game map details
      void Player.showMap(GameMap gameMap)
      This method is used show the details of the countries and continents, armies on each country, ownership of each country.
      void Player.startGameFortification(GamePlayer player, GameMap gameMap)
      This method is called from the Startup phase when the user opts to start the fortification.
      void Player.startReinforcement(GamePlayer player, GameMap mapDetails)
      This method asks the player to be continued with Reinforcement phase.
